name: 英文（三）：科技英文
restrict: ◎必須先修過【英文（一）】◎必須先修過【英文（二）】
description:
藉由主題式課程，加深學生對該領域實務趨勢認識、議題簡報、實務案例討論與批判分析。
強化學生該領域之實務/任務型英語口語溝通、簡報、寫作表達能力
goals: 提升英語組織與跨文化溝通表達能力
培養實務案例批判及分析能力
拓展國際視野及移動力
促進實務領域的協作能力
syllabus:
**ENGLISH III—Applied English (English for Science and Technology)**

**Spring 2020**

**13:20-15:10, Thursdays**

Classroom: 樸105

Instructor: 劉貞妤Chen-Yu Liu (chenyuliu1019@ntnu.edu.tw)

**Textbook:**

There is no textbook for this course.

Assigned reading materials and video clips will be available on Moodle.

**Requirements & Grading policy:**

*   **Attendance and Participation 20%**

Punctual attendance and active participation are required. Participation also includes teamwork and group projects.

If you are habitually late or absent, points will be deducted and you may fail this course. Exceptions are allowed only under emergent circumstances or notification in advance. Please inform me in advance through email if you will not be able to attend the class.

*   **Students’ Lesson 30%**

Each group will be responsible for choosing an article, video or other material under the general theme of science and technology.

**PLEASE EMAIL ME YOUR MATERIAL AND UPLOAD IT TO MOODLE MORE THAN A WEEK BEFORE THE CLASS!**

For the student lesson, each group will give a short PPT presentation summarizing the main points of their chosen material. Each group will also have to prepare a comprehension and discussion worksheet on the material to be followed by an activity or a game.

*   **Reflection 10%**

Write one reflection (at least 250 words) based on any topic not reported by you.

Submit your reflections through Moodle before the assigned due day (Check the schedule). **LATE ASSIGNMENTS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED.**

*   **How-to essay 10%**

Choose a topic you like and write an essay explaining how something is done. You can choose to use the same topic as your final video presentation. Different topics will also be acceptable.

*   **Final Video Presentation 30%**

Make a how-to video (3-5 minutes) teaching your classmate how things are done.

Make sure to include descriptions and explanations in English so your audience can understand what you are doing and learn the most from your video.
